content.description: Stand start the middle face with your left hand on a bad crimp, and your right hand on a compression-y hold on the arete below mini-roof. Get a left heel hook on the crimp start of Driveby Dreams, and fire your way up using compression moves and wide pinches. This is super fun!
content.protection: A couple pads and definitely a spotter.
content.location: In the middle of the face, it is in between Driveby Dreams and Half Crackarete.

content.description:
The start of this climb is definitely the crux. When you stick it the move around the arete it is super satisfying. This climb is one of the highlights of Wilson Mt. and everyone should try this at least once when you're at the Creek Boulders. 

  Starts on two lower crimps in the crack on the right side of the arete, rock up to solid crimp around left side of arete, throw left to solid jug at the top. Smooth sailing from there.
content.location: This is on the lower of the two boulders. The start is on the two lowest crimps in the crack on the right side of the rock.

content.description: Start with your left hand on a sidepull, your right hand on a crimp, and your feet starting in the cave. Drive by with your right to a jug and then up left to a juggy sidepull, then move up a slabby section with some solid crimps. This climb is reminiscent of going over the lip at Hammond Pond's Hermit Cave.
content.protection: 1 pad is usually fine, although you must be careful of the tree.
content.location: This is on the lower of the two creek boulders and starts on the lower left side of the boulder.

content.description: This area has potential for some harder routes. If anyone finds new stuff, it would be cool to put it on here. This rock is granite and has a small cave on the underside of the rock. There are 3 climbable surfaces on the rock, the side the routes are on is the right and left side. There is a middle area in between the left and right that have potential for a very hard route. The other boulder in the Creek Boulder area doesn't have any routes on it, as of now, but has potential for it. This boulder is directly behind the first boulder and isn't as hard. It is also made of granite and is we think that at one point these two boulders were just one big boulder. This is definitely a must go place if you decide to go out here.
